meanings.definition: Capable of being violated or infringed upon.
meanings.sent1: The fragile lock showed its violability when it easily broke under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The security of the building was compromised due to its violability.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's invincibility was put to the test by the villain's violability ray.
meanings.sent4: The violability of trust in their relationship shattered like glass.
meanings.sent5: The violability of the treaty made it difficult to maintain peace.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be broken or breached.
meanings.sent1: The violability of the dam led to a catastrophic flood in the town.
meanings.sent2: The violability of the fortress walls allowed the enemy to breach the defenses.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the violability of the seemingly solid box.
meanings.sent4: The violability of the contract became evident when one party failed to uphold their end.
meanings.sent5: The violability of the glass was tested by the impact of the baseball.
